intro: Steinchisma, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species native to sub-Saharan Africa, characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plants typically have succulent leaves and stems, adapted to arid environments. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value. Steinchisma species are known for their ability to thrive in dry conditions, making them suitable for xeriscaping.
